context: Results have already been reported which describe the occurrence of priority VOCs in the southern North Sea. In this work, we present our findings on VOC levels in the Scheldt estuary. For this, the occurrence and spatial-temporal variability of priority CHCs, MAHs and CMAHs were studied along the trajectory Vlissingen (the Netherlands)—Temse (Belgium) during a 3-year monitoring survey, from May 1998 till November 2000. Analytes The following VOCs were selected from the ‘List of Priority Hazardous Substances’ and ‘Reference List of Substances’ established at the 3rd International Conference on the Protection of the North Sea: 1,1-dichloroethene (DCE11), trans-1,2-dichloroethene (tDCE12), 1,1-dichloroethane (DCA11), chloroform (CHCl3), 1,1,1-trichloroethane (TRI111), tetrachloromethane (CCl4), 1,2-dichloroethane (DCA12), trichloroethene (TCE), 1,2-dichloropropane (DCP12), 1,1,2-trichloroethane (TRI112), tetrachloroethene (PCE), hexachloro-1,3-butadiene (HCB), cyclohexane (CYCLO), toluene (TOL), ethylbenzene (EtBENZ), m/p-xylene (MPXYL), o-xylene (OXYL), chlorobenzene (ClBENZ), 1,3-dichlorobenzene (DCB13), 1,4-dichlorobenzene (DCB14), 1,2-dichlorobenzene (DCB12), 1,3,5-trichlorobenzene (TCB135), 1,2,4-trichlorobenzene (TCB124) and 1,2,3-trichlorobenzene (TCB123).Sampling Water samples were taken over the period 1998–2000 on board the Dutch research vessel ‘Luctor’ from the ‘NIOO (Nederlands Instituut voor Oecologisch Onderzoek)’, Yerseke, the Netherlands at fourteen stations located along the trajectory Vlissingen—Temse. The sampling stations are shown in Fig. 1. Campaigns were conducted in May 1998, October 1998, May 1999, November 1999, April 2000 and November 2000. Hence, the survey provided a data set of 84 samples.

llm_generation.summary: In this context, 1,4-dichlorobenzene is listed among various volatile organic compounds (VOCs) that were selected as analytes for monitoring in the Scheldt estuary. The term 'analyte' refers to the substances being measured or analyzed in the study, indicating that 1,4-dichlorobenzene is one of the target compounds for assessment in the environmental monitoring of VOC levels. However, there is no detailed discussion of its specific properties or interactions within the context provided.
llm_generation.reason: The score of 2 reflects an indirect connection, as 1,4-dichlorobenzene is categorized as an analyte among other VOCs. While they share a common context of environmental monitoring, there is no detailed relationship or interaction discussed between them.
